When they first appear they are invisible and have no combat level, and try to turn food into useless rotten food; if players have no food they will do damage instead. Building the Fire of Dehumidification in the area stops these attacks (requires the completion of Making Friends with My Arm).

Ghast
Released13 July 2004 (Update)
MembersYes
RaceUndead
LocationMorytania
QuestNature Spirit
ExamineArrghhh... A Ghast.
Advanced data
NPC ID945, 5622, 5623, 5624

Ghasts are lingering souls of people that starved to death in Mort Myre swamp. When they first appear they are invisible and have no combat level, and try to turn food into useless rotten food; if players have no food they will do damage instead. Building the Fire of Dehumidification in the area stops these attacks (requires the completion of Making Friends with My Arm).

Ghasts can only be killed after completion of the Nature Spirit quest. You must have a filled Druid pouch to kill them. You must use the ability of the blessed silver sickle near some dead logs or bushes to harvest Mort myre fungi, stems, or pears then put those into a druid pouch by filling it. When your druid pouch has been filled, you can use it to make a Ghast visible, or wait until a Ghast attacks you to make it visible. This renders the Ghast vulnerable to attack; killing it rewards the player with 30 Prayer experience. Higher level ghasts reward more prayer experience upon death.

The salve amulet's bonuses do not work on the ghasts, nor can Crumble Undead be used on them.

Locations[edit | edit source]

Location Levels Members Spawns Map
Mort Myre Swamp30186Maplink

Ghast hunting notes[edit | edit source]

A ghast dying.

Due to the nature of making the Ghasts visible, they are not good for combat training. They do drop lots of herbs, but so do Hobgoblins. The material drops are pretty weak as well. You do, however, gain reasonable Prayer XP as well as Combat XP for killing them.

The best place to hunt them would be just west of the Nature Grotto from the Nature Spirit quest. This allows you to keep refreshing your prayer points without using valuable prayer potions. A player can use whichever weapon they choose for combat, a silver sickle is not needed to kill them. Fully charge your prayer points, go west of the Grotto (where the Ghasts are) and cast Bloom with the sickle next to the rotten logs. Try and do it between 2 logs, and you will occasionally get 2 mushrooms to put in the Druid pouch. Do this over and over until you are out of prayer points. Now "use" the filled pouch on the ghostly Ghasts - do not wait for them to attack you. Often they will just float around, or the pouch will activate itself, allowing the solid Ghast to float out over the water where it cannot be attacked. The drops will more often than not fall under the rotten logs, so search the ground carefully after defeating the Ghast.

You can actually fill the druid pouch much faster if you cast bloom near fallen tree branches, their trimmings count for 2 in your druid pouch as opposed to mushrooms only counting for one charge.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
6 January 2021
(update | poll)

Ghasts were made into spectral creatures.

5 March 2015
(update | poll)

There is now a 50% chance that a ghast will ignore you instead of attacking if you have completed the Morytania Easy Diary.

5 March 2013
(update)

The food-rotting special attack of ghasts has been adjusted slightly to fix a bug.

22 February 2013
(update)

This content was included when the Old School RuneScape servers officially launched.

'''Ghasts''' are lingering souls of people that starved to death in [[Mort Myre swamp]]. When they first appear they are invisible and have no [[combat level]], and try to turn food into useless [[rotten food]]; if players have no food they will do damage instead. Building the [[Fire of Dehumidification]] in the area stops these attacks (requires the completion of [[Making Friends with My Arm]]).

Ghasts can only be killed after completion of the [[Nature Spirit]] [[quest]]. You must have a filled [[Druid pouch]] to kill them. You must use the ability of the [[Silver sickle (b)|blessed silver sickle]] near some dead logs or bushes to harvest [[Mort myre fungi]], [[Mort myre stem|stems]], or [[Mort myre pear|pears]] then put those into a druid pouch by ''filling'' it. When your druid pouch has been filled, you can use it to make a Ghast visible, or wait until a Ghast attacks you to make it visible. This renders the Ghast vulnerable to attack; killing it rewards the player with 30 [[Prayer]] experience. Higher level ghasts reward more prayer experience upon death.

The [[salve amulet]]'s bonuses do '''not''' work on the ghasts, nor can [[Crumble Undead]] be used on them.

==Ghast hunting notes==
[[File:Ghast dying.gif|thumb|upright|A ghast dying.]]
Due to the nature of making the Ghasts visible, they are not good for [[combat]] training. They do drop lots of [[herbs]], but so do [[Hobgoblins]]. The material drops are pretty weak as well. You do, however, gain reasonable Prayer XP as well as Combat XP for killing them.

The best place to hunt them would be just west of the [[Nature Grotto]] from the [[Nature Spirit]] quest. This allows you to keep refreshing your [[prayer points]] without using valuable [[prayer potions]]. A player can use whichever weapon they choose for combat, a silver sickle is not needed to kill them. Fully charge your prayer points, go west of the Grotto (where the Ghasts are) and cast [[Bloom]] with the sickle next to the rotten logs. Try and do it between 2 logs, and you will occasionally get 2 mushrooms to put in the [[Druid pouch]]. Do this over and over until you are out of prayer points. Now "use" the filled pouch on the ghostly Ghasts - do not wait for them to attack you. Often they will just float around, or the pouch will activate itself, allowing the solid Ghast to float out over the water where it cannot be attacked. The drops will more often than not fall under the rotten logs, so search the ground carefully after defeating the Ghast.

You can actually fill the druid pouch much faster if you cast bloom near fallen tree branches, their trimmings count for 2 in your druid pouch as opposed to mushrooms only counting for one charge.
